title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement celedallago@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to meteorologia2.0
text: outlines propose change meteorologia2.0. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to meteorologia2.0
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to meteorologia2.0
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to meteorologia2.0
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("celestedallago/meteorologia2.0", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to meteorologia2.0
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to meteorologia2.0
text: Please note meteorologia2.0 project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: meteorologia
text: Siga esta guia de pasos para poder usar el paquete meteorologia2.0de una forma util y practica PRIMER PASO: Importar la libreria del paquete meteorologia2.0 de la siguiente forma SEGUNDO PASO: Descarga el/los dataset que desea usar. Este paso se realiza llamando la funcion descargar_datos() la cual de parametro le asignaras el id del dataset seleccionado TERCER PASO: Ya podras tener acceso al dataset elejido, para poder visualizarlo.
code: library(meteorologia2.0) estacion_elegida <- descargar_datos("NH0910") #> Descargando y leyendo el archivo de estacion 'NH0910' en el directorio #> temporal. head(estacion_elegida, 6) #>       id      fecha temperatura_abrigo_150cm temperatura_abrigo_150cm_maxima #> 1 NH0910 1975-01-01                    21.00                            31.0 #> 2 NH0910 1975-01-02                    21.25 NH0910 1975-01-05                    19.00                            22.0 #> 6 NH0910 1975-01-06                    22.25                            27.5 #>   temperatura_abrigo_150cm_minima title: Authors and Citation
text: Celeste Dal Lago. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Dal Lago C (2024). meteorologia2.0: Paquete Meteorologico. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://celestedallago.github.io/meteorologia2.0/, https://github.com/celestedallago/meteorologia2.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {meteorologia2.0: Paquete Meteorologico},   author = {Celeste {Dal Lago}},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://celestedallago.github.io/meteorologia2.0/},   url = {https://github.com/celestedallago/meteorologia2.0}, }

title: Paquete Meteorologico
text: El objetivo de meteorologia2.0 es poder analizar y manipular datos meteorologicos de distintos data sets

title: Paquete Meteorologico
text: Puedes instalar la version de desarrollo de meteorologia2.0 desde GitHub con:

title: Paquete Meteorologico
text: Para poder descargar los distintos dataset que se ofrecen de las estaciones meteorologicas deberas seguir los siguientes pasos: deberas llamar la funcion descargar_datos como parametro esta funcion se debera colocar el id correspondiente al dataset que deseas descargar. Los dataset disponibles son: -NH0910 -NH0098 -NH0437 -NH0046 -NH0472

title: Paquete Meteorologico
text: fahrenheit_a_centigrados: Esta funcion devuelve la temperatura ingresada en grados fahrenheit grados centigrados centigrados_a_fahrenheit: Esta funcion devuelve la temperatura ingresa en grados centigrados grados fahrenheit

title: Paquete Meteorologico
text: Este es un ejemplo basico de como instalar la libreria del paquete:

title: Paquete Meteorologico
text: Si deseas contribuir al paquete, ya sea para mejorar funcionalidades, corregir errores o proponer nuevas características, sigue estos pasos: Haz un fork y clona el repositorio: Realiza un fork de este repositorio en tu cuenta de GitHub y luego clónalo en tu máquina local. Haz tus modificaciones y crea un pull request: Realiza los cambios que consideres necesarios en tu copia del repositorio. Luego, abre un pull request hacia la rama principal del proyecto, asegurándote de incluir una descripción clara sobre el propósito de tu contribución. Si tienes alguna duda o necesitas asistencia durante el proceso de contribución, dudes en contactarme: Celeste Dal Lago / celedallago@gmail.com

what: Conjunto de datos de NH0046 — NH0046
title: Conjunto de datos de NH0046 — NH0046
text: Este conjunto de datos contiene información meteorológica específica para la estación NH0046.

title: Conjunto de datos de NH0046 — NH0046
Conjunto de datos de NH0046 — NH0046
text: Un data frame con 17041 filas y 35 columnas: ID ID de la estacion fecha Fecha de la obtencion de los datos temperatura_abrigo_150cm Temperatura medida 150 cm de altura. temperatura_abrigo_150cm_maxima Temperatura máxima 150 cm. temperatura_abrigo_150cm_minima Temperatura mínima 150 cm. temperatura_intemperie_5cm_minima Temperatura mínima en intemperie 5 cm. temperatura_intemperie_50cm_minima Temperatura mínima en intemperie 50 cm. temperatura_suelo_5cm_media Temperatura media del suelo 5 cm. temperatura_suelo_10cm_media Temperatura media del suelo 10 cm. temperatura_inte_5cm Temperatura interna 5 cm. temperatura_intemperie_150cm_minima Temperatura mínima en intemperie 150 cm. humedad_suelo Humedad del suelo. precipitacion_pluviometrica Precipitación medida. granizo 1 si hubo granizo y 0 si hubo. nieve 1 si hubo nieve y 0 si hubo. heliofania_efectiva Heliofanía efectiva. heliofania_relativa Heliofanía relativa. tesion_vapor_media Tensión de vapor media. humedad_media Humedad media. humedad_media_8_14_20 Humedad media de 8 14 y 20. rocio_medio Rocío medio. duracion_follaje_mojado Duración del follaje mojado. velocidad_viento_200cm_media Velocidad media del viento 200 cm. direccion_viento_200cm Dirección del viento 200 cm. velocidad_viento_1000cm_media Velocidad media del viento 1000 cm. direccion_viento_1000cm Dirección del viento 1000 cm. velocidad_viento_maxima Velocidad máxima del viento. presion_media Presión media. radiacion_global Radiación global. radiacion_neta Radiación neta. evaporacion_tanque Evaporación en tanque. evapotranspiracion_potencial Evapotranspiración potencial. profundidad_napa Profundidad de napa. horas_frio Horas de frío. unidad_frio Unidad de frío.

title: Convertidor de centigrados a fahrenheit — centigrados_a_fahrenheit
Descargar datos — descargar_datos
text: Algunas de las estaciones disponibles para descargar son: -NH0910 -NH0437 -NH0046 -NH0472 -NH0098

title: Descargar datos — descargar_datos
text: id_estacion es una identificacion confomado por dos letras mayusculas y cuatro numeros

title: Descargar datos — descargar_datos
text: Nos devuelve el dateset del id ingresado

title: Descargar datos — descargar_datos
code: data <- descargar_datos ("NH0910") #> Descargando y leyendo el archivo de estacion 'NH0910' en el directorio #> temporal.
